The Peach Lord of the Gate of Life governs the mandate of received qi, being the Lord of Primordial Qi. Returning essence to spirit, refining essence into whiteness, merging to transform the primal circle, standing forth at the inception—truly the resource of Heaven and Earth, the numinous origin of yin and yang. The treasure of the Golden Gate, Jade Pass, and Chamber’s Portal all submit their mandate to the qi of the Peach Lord.

Thus, when the Great One returns the radiance, the Imperial Lord unites the hun-souls. "Returning the radiance" means blending all transformations as one; "uniting the hun-souls" means transmuting essence-fluid to engender life. The inception of essence-transformation is intoned by the Peach Lord, thereby distinguishing the signs of male and female.

The Peach Lord is named Child Dao-Kang, styled Harmonizing Essence-Prolonging, also called Mandate Jade or Womb Root. By day, he governs within the Five Domains of the Golden Gate—this is the Gate of Life at the navel’s center, the palace of the Lower Cinnabar Field. By night, he governs within the Six Harmonies, to the right of the Great One.

Each evening, after completing the visualization, recite the incantation:
"Mysterious Origin congeals essence, Void unites with mist,
The knot of the womb-chamber, the intimacy of yin and yang,
The Three Supreme Qi descend into my body,
A hundred joints receive numen, ten thousand spirits each arrayed,
Chaos merged as one, named the Peach Lord,
Formed as at first birth, radiant and soaring to Heaven,
Clad in five-colored robes, adorned with phoenix-patterned splendor,
Holding the divine talisman, uniting the Imperial Lord’s hun-soul,
Girded with tiger-script sash, crowned with red kerchief and cinnabar cap,
Seated on golden grove and jade couch, directly before the Gate of Life,
Mouth inhaling essence-qi, strengthening my bones and joints,
To the right, a divine maiden holds a vermilion banner,
To the left, a jade lad records the Imperial Lord’s words,
Yang qi moves leftward, chaos undivided,
Yin qi passes rightward, flowing through seven revolutions,
Descending to the lowest depths, ascending to the Muddy Pellet,
Ever roaming the Nine Palaces, entering and exiting the Dark Gate,
Refining hun and po between the Six Palaces,
Registering the ten thousand spirits, ascending with me as immortals."

The above is the method of the Three and Five merging to transform and engender the Five Spirits. These Five Spirits receive the great numen of the Five Qi and accord with the origin of the Mysterious Mandate. Above, they engender the Void; below, they congeal the singular body. The life-within-life of the body requires the Five Spirits for its arising and abiding.

Each evening, the practitioner should visualize and recite this. If unable to recite silently, one may follow the text by day—it need not be at midnight, but rather when the qi of life arises. The three hun-souls are born of the Five Spirits, and the Three Perfected emerge from the Five Numinous Ones; thus, this Way is called the Method of Merging the Three and Five.

Those who practice it attain long life without death. This Way is named "The Northern Inspection of the Luminous Hall, Traversing the Purple Palace, Engendering and Transforming the Three and Five to Audience at the Upper Primordial." Even those who have already attained immortality should practice it, for those who practice it abide in eternal life.

After completing the visualization of the Three and Five merging, close the eyes and inwardly gaze, knock the teeth nine times, and swallow saliva nine times. Then softly recite the incantation:

"Perfected of the Nine Origins, truly possessing Three Fields,
Cloud chambers and golden halls, within dwell the Five Numinous Ones,
Commanding awe and might, transforming the dark and hidden,
Encompassing the Mysterious Mirror, weaving through Heaven and Earth,
Three and Five revert and return, merging with the Grand Clarity,
Yang qi flows and moistens, transforming into the Nameless,
Ascending with me as immortals, reaching the Divine Court,
Sun and moon gaze upon each other, the Three Luminaries blend their forms,
Transcending the Eight Extremes,
Crowned with Heaven’s essence, turning left and glancing right,
Holding the Seven Stars, concealing the body in the Grand Tenuity,
Uniting with the Primordial Qi of the Origin."

After reciting the incantation, visualize the Five Spirits each seated in their palaces. The Five Spirits all exhale purple qi to coil around the body until the purple qi is dense and obscure, and inner and outer merge indistinguishably—hands and feet no longer visible—then cease.

Next, visualize the sun and moon emerging from the left and right cheeks, the sun on the left and the moon on the right, their two lights penetrating and illuminating, whereupon the purple qi suddenly disperses.

Then visualize the sun entering your mouth and consume it, savoring its sweetness, swallowing nine times before stopping. Next, visualize the moon entering your navel, below the Gate of Life, illuminating the chamber of yin.

Then visualize yourself grasping the handle of the Northern Dipper’s Seven Stars, wearing them as you walk into the Purple Chamber of the Grand Tenuity Palace to meet the Imperial Lord. The Imperial Lord says: "You have attained divine transcendence, you have attained long years. I inscribe for you the Azure Jade Talisman, writing upon the Nine Heavens."

I bow twice and say: "I beseech to conceal and rest in the Grand Tenuity, merge radiance with the Great One, arrayed in attendance upon the Imperial Lord, circling the Numinous Chamber."

The Imperial Lord then summons the Great One, who appears before the Imperial Lord. I then enter the mouth of the Great One, merging form and radiance into one body with the Great One. After a long while, all is complete. This is called "Merging with the Grand Clarity, Transforming into the Nameless, Sun and Moon Gazing Upon Each Other, Grasping the Seven Stars, Sharing Form with the Great One, Concealing the Body in the Imperial Court."

After completing the visualization of the Five Spirits, the incantation, and the inward gaze, open the eyes and click the teeth five times. Press the third finger of the left hand to the philtrum seven times, and the second finger of the right hand to the space between the eyebrows nine times. This is the method of "Reining In the Three, Five, Seven, and Nine," sealing and controlling the gates of the hundred spirits, ensuring the hundred spirits secure the practitioner’s palaces, the Three Perfected solidify the practitioner’s singular body, the Five Spirits guard the practitioner’s talismanic mandate, and the Imperial Lord oversees the practitioner’s myriad chambers.

After completing the practice, recite:
"Three and Five revert, Heaven covers and Earth begins,
I possess the Five Talismans, ascending to the Imperial Son,
The Three Primordials abide long, within the encampment’s enclosure,
Five colors..."

chunks.original_text: 相通，方圆元纪，外禳百凶，内拘百史，三真扶我，五神护己，统御魁刚，使我不死。 咒毕，存太一坐六合宫中，故与我合形同景也。 乃还两手指放其所摄处，又以两手掩口，微咒曰： 太一告诸神，皆持阴阳关，不得妄去其宫室，当受对於帝君，一如三真法，二如九天命。 此混合变化，所存所行都毕也。 太一常以甲午、丙午、戊午日日中时，下游绛宫，合形真人及兆身也。 此是为三合己也，三真炁也，三浑化也。 绛宫真人者，处心中之丹田，中元真人居其心中也。 《三一经》具记其事矣。 常以其日日中时，入室存太一下游绛宫，绛宫真人忽然与太一合形。 次又存我入绛宫，忽然复与太一合形。 於是绛宫之中，唯觉有太一之身，身形象服如兆体也。 但令形细眇然，有似生孩之始耳。 毕，又思存两鼻孔下，左有日，右有月，日中有黄精赤炁，月中有赤精黄炁。 精者，二明之质也。 色炁者，日月之烟也。 二炁郁郁，来入绛宫，绛宫溢满，二气复上入洞房中，洞房中郁满，又下至黄庭中。 黄庭中者，脐下三寸下丹田宫中也。 二炁既满，又入填溢太仓中，二炁洞彻郁郁，积胃管中。 存太一上行，正当胃管中，南向呼召下元丹田黄庭真人，衣黄衣，巾黄巾，与太一共坐，饮食精炁二十七咽。 良久毕，存黄庭真人咒曰： 日月之华，黄赤二精，圆光合炁，上发大，明，三元饮食，太一受灵。 又存太一与中元真人还入绛宫，黄庭真人还下丹田宫，太一与我合形，还六合宫。 毕，兆咒曰： 太一帝君上勑三元，又为我勑制百神，百神按次相次留我一身，不得妄出入金门牢玉关。 咒毕，又存乳下日月，从两鼻孔中上到洞房，洞房中有上一真人，天帝也。 天帝是帝君之子，帝君治太极紫房，天帝治两眉间却入三寸为泥丸，丹田上宫； 或治在两眉间却入二寸，为洞房宫也。 存上一天帝，左右手各持日月，左手持日，右手持月，天帝先食日月，兆当作十九咽。 作十九咽毕，天帝吐气，气临太一六合宫中，觉紫烟满宫，太一吸取紫烟，作十九咽止。 名曰混合三一帝，布日月精，变景三宫万神，常生者也。 九宫上一入帝室，三五合炁，其本一七，变入形相，保密五行参差同根节，此消魔中符，帝君之经也。 谓三真相推而上登，五神禀帝魂而下分。 常以甲子日夜半时，存太微紫房宫中，有一童子如婴孩之状，着朱衣，名干景精，字会元子，正当帝君之前，捧赤玉按，按上有兆五符及命籍也。 又存太一从六合宫来上，在帝君之左。 童子曰：符籍主生，万神皆听，甲乙之记，已书帝庭，请命太一，定甲之名。 甲，兆名也。 帝君曰：太一童子，百变入己，除死上生，周而复始，形内万真，一勑伯史。 於是兆身及童子，并合入太 一形中，良久毕，又存太一还六合宫也。 名曰混合童婴於始元之炁，化变太一於三真之际也。 故《大洞真经》曰：太微小童，常在帝前，其名景精，其姓曰干，合形太一，被服朱丹，五符命籍，把持玉按，帝君所命，主通诸神，此之谓也。 又《高上消魔经》曰：辛子景精，有神有威，合象三形，九道相推，衣服朱丹，步正参差，出入上元，太极内阶，知我者生，存我不衰，人无哭兆，　恃赖辟非，欲知吾家处，密问太微。

The interconnection is complete, the primordial cycle of square and circle unfolds. Externally, it wards off the hundred misfortunes; internally, it restrains the hundred officials. The Three Perfected support me, the Five Spirits protect my person, commanding the stalwart and unyielding, ensuring I do not die.

When the incantation is finished, visualize the Great One seated within the Sixfold Harmony Palace, thus merging form and radiance with me. Then return the fingers of both hands to their original positions, cover the mouth with both hands, and softly recite:

"The Great One commands all spirits, holding fast the gates of yin and yang. They must not recklessly abandon their palaces but await their reckoning before the Imperial Lord—first in accord with the law of the Three Perfected, second in accord with the mandate of the Nine Heavens."

This is the culmination of the merging and transformation, the completion of all visualization and practice.

The Great One regularly descends to the Crimson Palace at noon on *jia-wu*, *bing-wu*, and *wu-wu* days, merging form with the Perfected One and the practitioner’s body. This is called the "Threefold Union of the Self," the *qi* of the Three Perfected, the Threefold Primal Transformation.

The Perfected One of the Crimson Palace resides in the Cinnabar Field of the heart, while the Central Perfected One dwells within the heart. The *Scripture of the Three Ones* records these matters in full.

Regularly at noon on these days, enter the chamber and visualize the Great One descending to the Crimson Palace. Suddenly, the Perfected One of the Crimson Palace merges form with the Great One. Next, visualize yourself entering the Crimson Palace and suddenly merging form with the Great One once more. Within the Crimson Palace, only the body of the Great One is perceived, its form and attire mirroring the practitioner’s own—only finer and more subtle, as if newly born.

When this is complete, visualize below the two nostrils: on the left, the sun; on the right, the moon. Within the sun is yellow essence and red *qi*; within the moon is red essence and yellow *qi*. The essence is the substance of the two luminaries; the colored *qi* is the mist of the sun and moon. The two *qi* rise in abundance, entering the Crimson Palace until it overflows. The two *qi* then ascend into the Cavern Chamber, filling it to abundance, before descending into the Yellow Court. The Yellow Court is the Cinnabar Field Palace three inches below the navel.

Once the two *qi* are full, they enter and fill the Great Granary, permeating the stomach channel with their abundant brilliance. Visualize the Great One ascending to the center of the stomach channel, facing south to summon the Perfected One of the Yellow Court in the Lower Cinnabar Field. Clad in yellow robes and a yellow headscarf, the Perfected One sits with the Great One, partaking of the essence and *qi* with twenty-seven swallows.

After a long while, visualize the Perfected One of the Yellow Court reciting:

"The radiance of the sun and moon, the yellow and red essences,
Their round light merging *qi*, ascending in great brilliance,
The Three Primordials partake of the feast,
The Great One receives the numinous."

Then visualize the Great One and the Central Perfected One returning to the Crimson Palace, while the Perfected One of the Yellow Court descends to the Lower Cinnabar Field Palace. The Great One merges form with the practitioner and returns to the Sixfold Harmony Palace.

When this is complete, the practitioner recites:

"The Great One, Imperial Lord, commands the Three Primordials on high,
And for me commands and restrains the hundred spirits.
The hundred spirits, in proper order, remain within my body,
Never recklessly entering or exiting the Golden Gate or the Jade Barrier."

When the incantation is finished, visualize the sun and moon below the breasts, ascending from the two nostrils into the Cavern Chamber. Within the Cavern Chamber resides the Supreme Perfected One, the Celestial Emperor. The Celestial Emperor is the son of the Imperial Lord; the Imperial Lord governs the Purple Chamber of the Supreme Ultimate, while the Celestial Emperor governs the Mud Pill Palace three inches inward from the space between the eyebrows—the Upper Palace of the Cinnabar Field—or else governs the Cavern Chamber Palace two inches inward from the space between the eyebrows.

Visualize the Supreme Celestial Emperor, each hand holding the sun and moon—left hand holding the sun, right hand holding the moon. The Celestial Emperor first consumes the sun and moon, and the practitioner performs nineteen swallows. After nineteen swallows, the Celestial Emperor exhales *qi*, which descends upon the Sixfold Harmony Palace of the Great One. The palace is filled with purple mist, and the Great One inhales the purple mist, performing nineteen swallows before stopping. This is called the "Merging of the Three Ones and the Emperor," spreading the essence of the sun and moon, transforming the radiance of the Three Palaces and the myriad spirits—ensuring perpetual life.

The Supreme One of the Nine Palaces enters the Imperial Chamber, the *qi* of Three and Five merging. Its root is the One and Seven, transforming into form and appearance. It safeguards the Five Phases, their nodes intertwined—this is the talisman for dispelling demons, the scripture of the Imperial Lord. It is said: the Three Perfected ascend in mutual succession, while the Five Spirits, receiving the imperial soul, descend in division.

Regularly at midnight on *jia-zi* days, visualize within the Purple Chamber of the Supreme Tenuity Palace a youth resembling a newborn infant, clad in vermilion robes. His name is *Gan Jingjing*, his courtesy name *Huiyuanzi*, standing directly before the Imperial Lord, holding a red jade tablet upon which are inscribed the practitioner’s five talismans and life register.

Next, visualize the Great One ascending from the Sixfold Harmony Palace to stand at the Imperial Lord’s left. The youth says:

"The talismans and register govern life; all spirits obey.
The records of *jia* and *yi* are inscribed in the imperial court.
I request the mandate of the Great One to determine the name of *jia*—*jia* being the practitioner’s name."

The Imperial Lord says:

"Great One, youth of a hundred transformations, entering the self,
Eradicating death and ascending to life, cycling without end,
The myriad Perfected within the form—with a single command, the hundred officials are restrained."

Thereupon, the practitioner’s body and the youth merge into the form of the Great One. After a long while, visualize the Great One returning to the Sixfold Harmony Palace. This is called "Merging the Youth and Infant in the *qi* of the Primordial Beginning, transforming the Great One amid the Three Perfected."

Thus, the *Perfect Scripture of the Great Cavern* states:

"The Lesser Youth of the Supreme Tenuity,
Ever before the Emperor,
His name is *Jingjing*,
His surname *Gan*.
Merging form with the Great One,
Clad in vermilion and cinnabar,
Holding the five talismans, life register, and jade tablet,
Commanded by the Imperial Lord to govern all spirits—
This is the meaning."

The *Highest Scripture for Dispelling Demons* also states:

"*Xin-zi Jingjing*,
Possessing spirit and majesty,
Merging the three forms,
The nine paths mutually propel.
Clad in vermilion and cinnabar,
Walking with measured steps,
Entering and exiting the Upper Primordial,
The inner steps of the Supreme Ultimate.
Those who know me live,
Those who visualize me do not decline.
People lack omens of mourning,
Relying on me to avert calamity.
If you wish to know my dwelling,
Secretly inquire of the Supreme Tenuity."

chunks.original_text: 此胎中童子变胞太一之魂也。 知其名字者，天下万民无得哭兆之身也。 常存之，辟非灾万祸，长生不死矣。 施行变合之日，六甲皆佳，不必专用甲子日也。 太一五神奉五符奉五籍，上清帝君混合之道，求长生神仙之诀也。 右桃君符，以白为地，丹笔书之。 五帝内宝符，太一帝君混化合景之道也。 可以本命日书五符，共盛着锦囊中带之。 带之者长生不死。 又常以本命之月中，有本命之日时，入室书五符，向王顿服。 毕，咒曰： 太一五符，神籍记生，千年万岁，与天同龄，帝君把籍，命寿不倾。 若欲数服此符者，常以五月五日、七月七日、九月九日，夜半生炁时为佳，或以秋分日夜半矣。 上五籍奉五符混合帝君，常以本命日月、三月十五日、二十六日，夜半时生炁，取令一室清净，乃可行之。 坐卧任意，坐则接手临目。 临目者，常闭而不闭也。 卧则闭目内视，两手拊心上，存帝君上在太极紫房宫中坐，存太微小童侍帝君后，又存太素元成老子侍帝君左，又存太和皇成老子侍帝君右，次存泥丸宫天帝君上入紫房，对帝君前。 天帝者，三一之上真，帝君之子，泥丸洞房之宝神也。 又存帝君，命天帝使召六合宫五神。 五神者，太一、公子、白元、司命、桃君，合五人，皆着朱衣绛巾，一神各捧一白玉桉，桉上有一符，长一寸，广五分，籍长五寸，广一寸。 事事分别，各有所主，籍简在符之上也。 存籍有乡里姓名，如上法。 五神各奉，以诣天帝，天帝以次取着帝君前。 毕，又存帝君命天、帝召兆，令上诣紫房。 须臾，兆从左鼻孔中入，上诣紫房，到帝君前，帝君令兆桉次读籍。 读籍毕，以奉天帝，天帝取奉帝君。 帝君使兆以次服五符，毕。 帝君有命天帝，命召绛宫中元丹田真人，又召下元命门真人，诣紫房中。 须臾，二真人上诣紫房帝君前。 此二真人者，是中心，脐下三一神也。 又存天帝，天帝以忽合帝君形中，觉从口中入，变而合一也。 须臾，二老子又入帝君鼻两孔中。 须臾，觉见绛宫、命门二真人，又入帝君口中。 须臾，又觉见五神从帝君左耳孔中，入帝君六合中。 又存觉兆身及太微童子，从帝君右耳孔中，入帝君六合中。 都毕，帝君尔时独坐太微紫房宫中也。 其所命召诸神，并已合形内，变入形於帝君前矣。 存帝君咒曰： 太上玄清，天地同精，合景紫房，混化万生，五神三一，二老记名，太微童子，从兆反形。 千千万亿，长年以宁，后帝而存，神仙玉清。 毕，兆咒曰： 混合既毕，死籍已灭，天帝有命，不得忘失，百神帝君，各宝其室。 於是乃开目，毕。 此为五神奉符籍之时，魂神混合之道，兆精心思而存之焉。 右五籍五符混化必生券，以本命日日中时，朱书青纸，作此符一枚。 夜半入室存思毕，服一枚，向本命之处也。 余一枚，以铰刀中破，从上下黑沾处中分之，以一半付灶火中，以半付井水中。 每至本命日辄行之，名曰保神长至之符，帝君记命之券也。 以白纸青笔书之，本命日旦，东向服之毕，咒曰： 帝君制命，九炁同烟，使我不死，又得飞仙，制命安形，太上之宾。 以白纸雌黄书之，本命日日中时，南向服之毕，南向咒曰： 太一明灵，帝君合形，斩灭三尸，魂魄安宁，长在天中，九命无倾，飞升帝前，七道五生。

This is the transformation of the Womb Child into the Hun-soul of the Embryonic Great One. Those who know his name and appellation ensure that none among the myriad people of the world bear the omen of mourning. Constantly visualize him to avert misfortune and myriad disasters, and you shall attain long life without death.

On the day of performing this transformative union, all six Jia days are auspicious; there is no need to exclusively use the Jia-zi day. The Five Spirits of the Great One present the Five Talismans and Five Registers—this is the Dao of the Supreme Clarity Emperor Lord’s fusion and union, the secret to seeking long life and transcendence as a divine immortal.

The Peach Lord Talisman on the right is drawn with cinnabar on a white ground. The Five Thearchs’ Inner Treasure Talismans are the Dao of the Great One Emperor Lord’s fusion and transformation through union with the radiant essence. On your life-destiny day, inscribe the Five Talismans and store them together in a brocade pouch to carry on your person. Those who carry them attain long life without death.

Moreover, in the month of your life-destiny, on the day and hour corresponding to your life-destiny, enter your chamber and inscribe the Five Talismans. Face the king and swallow them at once. Upon completion, recite the incantation:

*"The Five Talismans of the Great One,
The spirit registers record life.
For a thousand years, ten thousand ages,
You shall share the same age as Heaven.
The Emperor Lord holds the register,
Commanding life-destiny without decline."*

If you wish to ingest this talisman multiple times, the most auspicious times are the fifth day of the fifth month, the seventh day of the seventh month, and the ninth day of the ninth month, at the hour when primordial qi is born at midnight, or alternatively at midnight on the autumnal equinox.

To present the Five Registers and Five Talismans for fusion with the Emperor Lord, on your life-destiny day and month, as well as on the fifteenth and twenty-sixth days of the third month, at the hour when primordial qi is born at midnight, ensure your chamber is pure and undefiled before proceeding. You may sit or lie down as you wish. If sitting, clasp your hands and bring them to your eyes. "Bringing them to your eyes" means keeping them closed yet not fully shut. If lying down, close your eyes and inwardly visualize. Place both hands over your heart and visualize the Emperor Lord seated in the Purple Chamber Palace of the Supreme Ultimate. Envision the Youth of the Supreme Tenuity attending behind the Emperor Lord, the Elder of Primordial Completion of Grand Simplicity attending to his left, and the Elder of Imperial Completion of Grand Harmony attending to his right. Next, visualize the Heavenly Emperor Lord of the Mud-Pill Palace ascending into the Purple Chamber to stand before the Emperor Lord. This Heavenly Emperor is the supreme perfected one of the Three Ones, the son of the Emperor Lord, the precious spirit of the Cavern Chamber of the Mud-Pill Palace.

Further visualize the Emperor Lord commanding the Heavenly Emperor to summon the Five Spirits of the Six Harmonies Palace. These Five Spirits—the Great One, the Noble Son, White Prime, the Controller of Destinies, and the Peach Lord—are five in number. Each wears vermilion robes and a crimson headscarf, and each holds a white jade tablet. Upon each tablet rests a talisman, one inch in length and five fen in width, with a register five inches long and one inch wide placed above it. Each has distinct duties and domains, with the register scrolls positioned above the talismans. Visualize the registers bearing your native place, name, and appellation, as described above. The Five Spirits each present their registers to the Heavenly Emperor, who in turn arranges them before the Emperor Lord.

Upon completion, visualize the Emperor Lord commanding the Heaven and Earth Emperors to summon your spirit, bidding it ascend to the Purple Chamber. In an instant, your spirit enters through your left nostril, ascends to the Purple Chamber, and arrives before the Emperor Lord. The Emperor Lord instructs your spirit to take the tablets in order and read the registers. After reading, your spirit presents them to the Heavenly Emperor, who then offers them to the Emperor Lord. The Emperor Lord commands your spirit to ingest the Five Talismans in sequence.

The Emperor Lord then instructs the Heavenly Emperor to summon the Perfected of the Crimson Palace of the Central Cinnabar Field and the Perfected of the Life Gate of the Lower Primordial, bidding them come to the Purple Chamber. In an instant, the two Perfected ascend to the Purple Chamber before the Emperor Lord. These two Perfected are the Three Ones of the Central Palace, the spirits of the heart and the navel below.

Next, visualize the Heavenly Emperor suddenly merging with the Emperor Lord’s form, entering through your mouth and uniting with him. In an instant, the two Elders enter the Emperor Lord’s two nostrils. Then, perceive the two Perfected of the Crimson Palace and Life Gate entering the Emperor Lord’s mouth. In another instant, perceive the Five Spirits entering the Emperor Lord’s Six Harmonies through his left ear. Finally, visualize your own spirit and the Youth of the Supreme Tenuity entering the Emperor Lord’s Six Harmonies through his right ear.

When all is complete, the Emperor Lord sits alone in the Purple Chamber Palace of the Supreme Tenuity. All the summoned spirits have merged within his form, transformed and united before the Emperor Lord. Then visualize the Emperor Lord reciting the incantation:

*"Supreme Mystery and Profound Clarity,
Heaven and Earth share the same essence.
United with the radiant essence in the Purple Chamber,
Fusion transforms the myriad lives.
The Five Spirits and Three Ones,
The Two Elders record names.
The Youth of the Supreme Tenuity,
Returns to form with your spirit.
For thousands upon thousands of myriads,
You shall enjoy long years of peace.
Preserve me as your sovereign,
And ascend as an immortal to Jade Clarity."*

Upon completion, you recite the incantation:

*"The fusion is complete,
The register of death is obliterated.
The Heavenly Emperor commands,
Never forget nor lose this.
The Hundred Spirits and Emperor Lord,
Each treasure their abode."*

Then open your eyes and conclude. This is the method for the Five Spirits presenting the talismans and registers, the Dao of the fusion of hun-soul and spirit. Focus your essence and mind to visualize it.

The Life-Guarantee for the Fusion of the Five Registers and Five Talismans: On your life-destiny day at noon, inscribe this talisman in cinnabar on blue-green paper, creating one copy. At midnight, enter your chamber, complete the visualization, and ingest one copy while facing your life-destiny direction. Take the remaining copy and cut it in half with scissors, dividing it at the black-stained center. Place one half in the stove fire and the other in the well water. Perform this ritual on every life-destiny day; it is called the Talisman for Preserving the Spirit and Prolonging Life, the Emperor Lord’s Record of Command.

Inscribe it with a blue-green brush on white paper. On your life-destiny day at dawn, face east and ingest it, then recite the incantation:

*"The Emperor Lord issues the command,
The nine qi merge as one smoke.
He causes me not to die,
And further to ascend as a flying immortal.
The command stabilizes my form,
I become a guest of the Supreme."*

Inscribe it with realgar on white paper. On your life-destiny day at noon, face south and ingest it, then face south and recite the incantation:

*"The Great One is luminous and numinous,
The Emperor Lord unites with my form.
Sever the Three Corpses,
Hun and po are at peace.
Abide forever in Heaven,
The nine destinies remain unshaken.
Ascend before the Emperor,
The seven paths and five lives."*

chunks.original_text: 以白纸丹笔书之，以本命日暮，向本命服之。 服毕，咒： 天玄地黄，三魂在堂，天黄地玄，三魂在人，不黄不玄，帝君记年，不玄不黄，太一不忘，使我安形，万寿无疆。 右太一制三魂七魄宝命符，常以本命之月、本命之日、本命之时，朱书白纸，北向服之。 若不知生月日时者，唯所知一耳，亦可以戊午日日中时服之。 右太上宝神招帝君符，以八节日日中时，朱书白纸服之毕，咒曰： 太上三玄，帝君在魂太一五灵，保魂安身，紫房有令，勑制百神。 帝君太一内精神符，合十二首，皆太上元精之炁也。 至真至秘，不得妄传也。 其别复有太一外诀符文，大异者，乃皆中矜帝昌经上符也。 非此真者，用之无效，兆善敬慎之。 帝君讳逢凌梵，字履昌灵，一名七灵，一名神丈人，常治太极紫房中，端坐平正，貌如婴儿之状，常有紫炁覆其神形，衣五色华衣，巾日月之冠，左耳上有日，径九寸，右耳上有月，径一尺。 日日夕夕常常自存之，此是帝君正形之时，非变化之为也。 帝君口常咏一文曰： 微微深哉，玄首虚全，八风散景，变化冥渊，幽然绝洞，朗矣寄玄，七神徘徊，炼柔三魂，上帝用安，惠在兆身，兆身常斋，慎履飞尘，我则熙乐，保兹泥丸，血尸入目，秽炁纷纷，帝与太一，并命五神，弃官废宅，径升九天，子则忤矣，三命即颠，岂若寂静，与我缠绵。 此帝君之常吟咏太上虚室之神章也。 子常当诵习之。 其文以秽殗为急吾谓为冥矣。 兆有知帝君名字者，忌，可不慎之。 兆若有罪过，欲首谢求除罪者，夜半及日中入室，闭目端坐，北向存帝君在兆紫房中，存思如上。 因又存兆身在紫房中，伏帝君前，内自陈□，并炁良久，匝令一身汗出，衣服沾蒸。 如此者三过，自解罪目散也。 汗匝一体毕，乃咒曰： 某甲有罪，上闻百神，乞度七九，水火之患，守命太一，拘济帝君，汗流一体，怖在三魂，恩惟太上，永令除患。 毕，因三呼帝君名字。 毕，乃开目。 名曰帝君懈过之道，内谢五神，流汗为应矣。 世人谢过，乃叩头搏颊，此外法也。 若修此法，若修行三一守洞房，帝君奉太一者，慎不可以叩头搏颊也。 夫人叩头者，惊三魂，扰泥丸，惨紫房，倾帝君也。 夫人搏颊者，则坚胞结，束魄筋，太一悲，五神迂，乃大忌也。 若所行所念，但心存叩头搏颊，亦内解於心中矣。 仙人存心拜而已，不形屈也，吾谓为冥矣。 兆有知帝君名字者，长生不死，形不入地矣。 慎不可以告人，告人则卫经玉童玉女去矣，非盟不传也。 常以庚申日日中入室，或用夜半，存思帝君在紫房中，帝君口吹一炁，辄成一人，凡作七吹炁，成七人。 又存太一从六合中宫来，上诣帝君前，兆己从太一合形，为一人身耳。 凡七吹炁成七人，太一及帝君又为二人，都合九人，名为七君、九君，领理血脉筋骨之道。 存帝君有命咒曰： 第一白气君务玄子，第二青炁君按延昌，第三黑炁君赋来生，第四黄炁君祖明车，第五赤炁君焜离子，皆五方色衣，巾五方巾，从次诸神，不得杂错。 第六上玄君高同生，第七下玄君叔火王，各朱衣黄巾，立吾后，抱图籍，奉五符。 今命第一君主炁，第二君主血，第三君主精，第四君主液，第五君主神，第六君主魂，第七君主魄，太一君主髓脑，帝君主本命。

The three hun dwell in the hall.
Heaven yellow, earth dark,
The three hun reside in man.
Neither yellow nor dark,
The Emperor Lord records the years.
Neither dark nor yellow,
The Great One does not forget.
He stabilizes my form,
Boundless longevity without end."*

This is the Great One’s Precious Command Talisman for Governing the Three Hun and Seven Po. Always on the month, day, and hour of your life-destiny, inscribe it in cinnabar on white paper and ingest it facing north. If you do not know your birth month, day, or hour, even knowing one will suffice; you may also ingest it on the wu-wu day at noon.

This is the Supreme Precious Talisman for Summoning the Emperor Lord. On the eight solar terms at noon, inscribe it in cinnabar on white paper, ingest it, and recite the incantation:

*"The Supreme Three Mysteries,
The Emperor Lord resides in the hun.
The Great One and Five Numinous Powers,
Protect the hun and stabilize the body.
The Purple Chamber holds command,
Issuing decrees to govern the hundred spirits."*

The Emperor Lord’s Inner Spirit Talisman of the Great One comprises twelve sections, all being the primordial qi of the Supreme Original Essence. It is most true and most secret—do not transmit it recklessly. There are also separate talismans of the Great One’s outer oral instructions, which differ greatly, being the superior talismans of the *Zhong Jin Di Chang Jing*. Those that are not authentic will be ineffective; you must be reverent and cautious.

The Emperor Lord’s taboo name is Feng Lingfan, his courtesy name Lü Changling. He is also called Seven Numinous Powers and Divine Elder. He constantly resides in the Purple Chamber of the Great Ultimate, sitting upright and proper, his appearance like that of an infant. A purple qi perpetually envelops his divine form. He wears a robe of five-colored radiance and a cap adorned with the sun and moon. Above his left ear is the sun, nine inches in diameter; above his right ear is the moon, one foot in diameter. This is the true form of the Emperor Lord at all times, not a transformation.

The Emperor Lord constantly recites a text that says:

*"Subtle and profound,
The Dark Prime is empty and complete.
The eight winds scatter light,
Transforming in the hidden abyss.
Silent and boundless,
Luminous and abiding in the mysterious.
The seven spirits wander,
Refining and softening the three hun.
The Supreme Lord is at peace,
Bestowing grace upon your body.
Your body must always be pure,
Cautious in treading the flying dust.
Then I shall be joyful,
Preserving this muddy pellet.
If blood-corpses enter the eyes,
Defiled qi swirls in profusion.
The Emperor and the Great One,
Together command the five spirits.
Abandon office and forsake dwelling,
Ascend directly to the Nine Heavens.
If you resist,
The three destinies will topple.
How much better to be still and tranquil,
Entwined with me in serenity."*

This is the Emperor Lord’s constant recitation of the Supreme’s divine chapter of the Empty Chamber. You should always study and recite it. Its urgency lies in impurity and filth—what I call the obscure.

If you know the Emperor Lord’s name and courtesy name, beware—you must not be careless. If you have transgressions and wish to confess, seek absolution, and have your sins removed, enter your chamber at midnight or noon, close your eyes, sit upright, and face north. Visualize the Emperor Lord in your Purple Chamber, meditating as described above. Then visualize your own body within the Purple Chamber, prostrating before the Emperor Lord. Internally confess your transgressions, holding your breath for a long while until your entire body is drenched in sweat, your clothes damp and steaming. Do this three times, and your sins will dissolve like scattered dust. Once your whole body is bathed in sweat, recite the incantation:

*"So-and-so has sinned,
Heard by the hundred spirits.
I beseech deliverance from the seven nines,
From the perils of water and fire.
The Guardian of Destiny, the Great One,
The Emperor Lord who restrains and saves,
Sweat flows through my entire body,
Terror grips the three hun.
I implore the Supreme,
To forever remove these perils."*

After reciting, call out the Emperor Lord’s name and courtesy name three times. Then open your eyes. This is called the Emperor Lord’s Method for Relieving Transgressions, an inner confession to the five spirits, with sweating as the sign of efficacy. When worldly people confess their faults, they kowtow and slap their cheeks—this is an external method. If you practice this method, or cultivate the Three Ones to guard the Grotto Chamber, with the Emperor Lord serving the Great One, be careful never to kowtow or slap your cheeks. Kowtowing startles the three hun, disturbs the muddy pellet, grieves the Purple Chamber, and topples the Emperor Lord. Slapping the cheeks hardens the womb and binds the sinews of the po, saddens the Great One, and disorients the five spirits—this is a great taboo. Whatever you do or think, if you mentally kowtow or slap your cheeks, it is inwardly resolved in the heart. Immortals bow in their hearts but do not physically prostrate—what I call the obscure.

If you know the Emperor Lord’s name and courtesy name, you will attain long life and immortality, and your body will not enter the earth. Be careful not to reveal them to others; if you do, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens of the Guardian Scriptures will depart. This is not to be transmitted without a covenant.

Always on the geng-shen day at noon, or at midnight, enter your chamber and visualize the Emperor Lord in the Purple Chamber. The Emperor Lord exhales a qi, and with each breath, a person is formed—seven breaths create seven people. Then visualize the Great One coming from the Central Palace of the Six Harmonies to stand before the Emperor Lord. Visualize yourself merging with the Great One, becoming one body. The seven breaths create seven people, and the Great One and the Emperor Lord make two more, totaling nine people. These are the Seven Lords and Nine Lords, who govern the pathways of blood, vessels, sinews, and bones.

Visualize the Emperor Lord issuing the command and reciting the incantation:

*"The First White Qi Lord, Wu Xuanzhi,
The Second Azure Qi Lord, An Yanchang,
The Third Black Qi Lord, Fu Laisheng,
The Fourth Yellow Qi Lord, Zu Mingche,
The Fifth Red Qi Lord, Kun Lizhi—
All wear robes of the five directions’ colors,
And caps of the five directions.
They follow in order,
No confusion permitted.
The Sixth Upper Mystery Lord, Gao Tongsheng,
The Seventh Lower Mystery Lord, Shu Huowang—
Each wears a vermilion robe and yellow cap,
Standing behind me,
Holding charts and registers,
Presenting the five talismans."*

The Second Lord governs blood,
The Third Lord governs essence,
The Fourth Lord governs fluids,
The Fifth Lord governs spirit,
The Sixth Lord governs the hun,
The Seventh Lord governs the po,
The Great One Lord governs marrow and brain,
The Emperor Lord governs the life-destiny.

chunks.original_text: 上关雕梁际等九人，中关太一务犹收九人，下关下一黄庭始明精等九人，三九二十七人，即日缘炁内咽，上开三关，关有二十四结，结有二十四筋，筋即以断，结已解散，津血上冲，径满泥丸，玉液下顺，哺养百神，即日某甲名上帝籍，长生神仙。 毕，又存太一名，兆上诣帝君前，帝君曰： 胞结已通，光内彻外，使尔长生，命不倾坠，汝可合我形中矣。 帝君因开口，觉我忽入帝君口中，径到帝君六合宫中，帝君六合中又有太一神，名重冥空，字幽寥无，因告兆曰：可食日精矣。 兆即取日精食之，作九咽止。 须臾，见向二十七真人，皆在兆左右立，二十七真人曰：某甲胎籍已解，秽炁皆除，面已玉泽，体洞太虚，长生亿万，帝君同符。 又存帝君咒曰： 天上同真，是甲之身，天上同灵，是甲之形。 良久，都毕也。 此为九君混合内化百神，解胞散结，开利三关，上合六合，并景帝君，变化命籍，炁镇泥丸，长生受符，方为天仙者也。 存思都毕，乃更散发，更梳头解衣，更结衣，洗手足者。 兆不能暗诵一二存念者，可入室按文施行之。 帝君泥丸中，又有六合宫，宫中有帝皇太一君，名重冥空，字幽寥无，兆知之者，朽骨更生，五藏生华，终身不畏怖。 畏怖之时，北向呼此名三过，咒曰： 罗阿重冥空雷风，幽寥无上生帝君，形佑兆，使无忧。 毕，如与千人同旅。 太一帝君解三关十二结胞胎内符，以本命日，若八节日，欲施行解结时，先吞此符三枚，向本命处，以真朱书青竹中白膜也。 白膜生於坚节之内，遂虚中而受灵者也，故书竹膜为解结之符文。 太一曰：人有三魂，利人之存，人有七魄，害人之命。 七魄朝在人左目下，暮在人鼻人中下，学道者欲卧，先以右手爪按左目下及人中，各三七过，甚佳，制七魄之道。 帝君太一宝玄玉经，太上真人藏於五岳华房之内，非有仙籍者，不得闻见此也。 见之者生，行之者仙。 是故重为盟誓，来其天真，以防宣泄，流布离行耳。 自天尊贵仙，然幽秘此道，非仙骨者不妄授此也，无至诚者不闻也。 有经曰师，受者礼焉。 经之传也，从师而受经，受经而用弟子之道也。 传授之际，各斋七日，或十日，先后又告斋，各复一日也。 古者盟誓，皆歃血断发，立坛告天，以为不宣示信人之约也。 今自可以金青之陈，以代发肤之体耳。 列於别静，祝启上皇。 法用金镮三枚，鲜明赤而有光者，青帛三九尺，以代三契之盟，亦可相连为二十七尺耳。 受书当写为两通，修一机一也，盟物备录，不得私用以自营也。 故太上中经曰：夫师因经业，故称之曰生受者，习焉以同其诚，推盟誓天，固神告灵，缠绵忧乐，义齐死生，於是始验克终，俱期仙庭矣。 尔乃奉拜谘受，修盟曲室，尊卑以显三洁，分别孜孜之心，宝经藏密，慎行要言，诚存专一，保敬师经，方寸敢坠，如此始可与言神灵之交，道德之契矣。 奉经而秘其道，行事而遵其誓，则以列名於玉简，书帝录於太极。 若违其道也，则七祖受风刀之考，玄母受胎灵之害，身为下鬼，门亦烟灭，摙蒙山之石，以投积夜之河，悲夫，有心之子，其慎秘也哉。 此太上真人契令，张天师演出於丹景经中，有是慎盟之书也。 受太上帝君之道，用事如此，故记而修行焉。

The Nine Lords of the Upper Pass, led by Diao Liangji, the Nine Lords of the Middle Pass including Taiyi Wuyoushou, and the Nine Lords of the Lower Pass beginning with Xiayi Huangting Shimingjing—these Twenty-Seven Lords of the Three Nines—on this day, with the internal swallowing of primordial qi, open the Three Passes above. Each Pass contains twenty-four knots, and each knot binds twenty-four sinews. Once the sinews are severed, the knots dissolve and scatter. The essence-blood surges upward, filling the Mud Pill Palace, while the Jade Nectar flows downward to nourish the hundred spirits. On this day, the name of so-and-so is inscribed in the Heavenly Register as a Perfected Immortal of Longevity.

When this is complete, visualize the name of Taiyi ascending before the Celestial Emperor. The Emperor says: "The fetal knots are now unblocked, your inner radiance shines through to the exterior. I grant you longevity, and your destiny shall not collapse. You may now merge with my form." The Celestial Emperor then opens his mouth, and I suddenly enter it, arriving directly at the Sixfold Palace within the Emperor. Within the Emperor’s Sixfold Palace resides another Taiyi spirit, named Chongmingkong, styled Youliaowu. He addresses me, saying: "You may now consume the essence of the sun." I then take the solar essence and swallow it nine times.

Presently, the Twenty-Seven Perfected Lords appear, standing to my left and right. They say: "So-and-so’s fetal register is now dissolved, all impure qi is expelled. Your countenance shines like jade, your body permeates the Great Void. You shall live for millions of years, in harmony with the Celestial Emperor." Then visualize the Celestial Emperor’s incantation: "In heaven, united with the Perfected—this is my body. In heaven, united with the Numinous—this is my form." After a long while, all is complete.

This is the Nine Lords’ fusion and internal transformation of the hundred spirits, the dissolution of the fetal knots, the untying of the Three Passes, the ascent to merge with the Sixfold Palace, and the union with the Radiant Celestial Emperor to alter one’s destiny in the register. The qi stabilizes in the Mud Pill Palace, and one receives the talisman of longevity, becoming a Heavenly Immortal.

Once the visualization is complete, loosen the hair, comb it again, untie and retie the garments, and wash the hands and feet. If one cannot silently recite or visualize even one or two parts, one may enter the chamber and perform the ritual according to the text.

Within the Celestial Emperor’s Mud Pill Palace is another Sixfold Palace, wherein resides the Celestial Sovereign Taiyi, named Chongmingkong, styled Youliaowu. Those who know this will regenerate from withered bones, their five viscera blossom, and they shall never know fear. In times of fear, face north and call this name three times, reciting the incantation: "Luo A Chongmingkong Leifeng, Youliaowu Shangsheng Dijun, protect my form and free me from sorrow." When this is done, it is as if one travels with a thousand companions.

The Taiyi Celestial Emperor unties the Three Passes and the twelve fetal knots of the internal talisman. On one’s natal day or during the Eight Seasonal Festivals, when performing the knot-untying ritual, first swallow this talisman three times, facing the direction of one’s natal constellation. The talisman is inscribed with cinnabar on the white membrane within green bamboo. This membrane grows within the hard nodes, hollow within yet receptive to the numinous—thus, the bamboo membrane is used to write the knot-untying talisman.

Taiyi says: "Humans possess three hun-souls, which benefit one’s preservation. Humans also possess seven po-souls, which harm one’s destiny. The seven po-souls dwell beneath the left eye by day and beneath the nose’s philtrum by night. Those who cultivate the Dao should, before lying down, press the right fingernail to the left eye’s underside and the philtrum, each thirty-seven times—this is excellent for restraining the seven po-souls."

The *Taiyi Baoxuan Yujing* of the Celestial Emperor is concealed by the Supreme Perfected within the Flowery Chambers of the Five Peaks. Those without immortal registers may not hear or see it. Those who see it shall live; those who practice it shall become immortals. Therefore, solemn oaths are repeatedly sworn to summon celestial perfected beings, preventing disclosure and unauthorized dissemination.

Since the Heavenly Worthy reveres the immortals, this Dao is kept profoundly secret. It is not casually transmitted to those without immortal bones, nor heard by those lacking utmost sincerity. The scripture says: "The master, by virtue of the scripture’s teachings, is called the living recipient." The disciple studies to align in sincerity, swearing oaths to heaven, solidifying the divine pledge, intertwining joys and sorrows, and equating the bond with life and death. Only then can one be tested and ultimately ascend together to the immortal courts.

Thus, one offers reverence and receives the teaching, performing the oath in a secluded chamber. Superior and inferior observe the Three Purities, distinguishing the earnestness of their devotion. The precious scripture is concealed, its essential words practiced with care. Sincerity is maintained with single-minded focus, honoring the master and scripture. Not a moment of negligence is permitted—only then may one speak of communion with the divine and the covenant of the Dao.

Those who receive the scripture and keep its Dao secret, who conduct affairs in accordance with their oaths, shall have their names inscribed on jade tablets and their imperial records written in the Supreme Ultimate.
